title: Colophon
publication_title: The Lithographs of James McNeill Whistler: The Digital Edition
content:
<section class="osci-tk-epub-section body" id="body">Designed by studio blue, Chicago.

Typeset by Paul Baker Typography, Inc., Chicago.

The typefaces used in this edition are Monotype Walbaum, Monotype Grotesque, and Franklin Gothic.

Monotype Walbaum, the serif typeface used in this edition, was designed in the early twentieth century by J. E. Walbaum for the Monotype Company, with offices in Chicago and the United Kingdom.

The sans-serif typefaces used in this edition are Monotype Grotesque and Franklin Gothic. Monotype. Grotesque was designed in the 1920s by the Monotype Company; Franklin Gothic was designed by M. F. Benton in 1903 for the American Type Founders Company.

Updated versions of these typefaces were composed in Quark Xpress version 3.32 on a Power Macintosh 7100/80 computer.

Digital photography and halftone separations by Martin Senn, Philomont, Virginia.

The original lithographs were scanned on location in the Department of Prints and Drawings at the Art Institute of Chicago by Martin Senn using a high-resolution Dicomed Digital Camera adapted to a Mamiya RC 67. Additional illustrations were scanned form black-and-white prints.

Additional photography by the Department of Imaging, the Art Institute of Chicago, Alan Newman, Executive Director.

Printed in an edition of 1500 copies by Meridian Printing, East Greenwich, Rhode Island.

The paper used for the text sheets this edition is printed on is Mohawk Vellum warm white, an acid-free paper. The endsheets are Ingres Fabriano grigio; the bookcloth is Iris.

Bound by Acme Binding, Charleston, Massachusetts.

</section>
